website_summaries.verdict: The Grain Audio IEHP.01 is a good-looking earphone pair with real walnut earpieces and distortion-free, extremely sculpted audio performance.
pros: Powerful audio performance with deep bass
cons: Wildly sculpted sound signature is not for purists
Deep lows and very bright highs mean less presence in the midrange

customer_reviews.title: Earbuds sound good but Company doesn't exist anymore
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these earbuds in 2015 they sound good, have good bass and decent highs, I had them for about a year before the cable pulled out of the 1/8" plug. No problem they still work, then maybe 6 months after that the right earbud stopped working. I paid $100 for these and I would say its not worth it (not to mention that they are now for sale on here for $400+ which is ridiculous) plus the company doesn't exist anymore but even when they did I submitted multiple requests to get them fixed but no response. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound quality plus the bonus of being extremely stylish
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but I love these headphones so much I thought I should let other people know. Great sound quality with a lot of clear bass. I much prefer these over the Klipsch s4-ii headphones I was using. The mic/volume controls only work with iPhone so that was the only downside for me. Not a big deal though because not very many people can say they have wood headphones! My headphones happened to come without a carrying case but I e-mailed Grain Audio and they sent one right away no questions asked. Great customer service. Show them some support and buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Wave91

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Android.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality. Yet another product designed to work exclusively with iPhones. Buttons won't answer calls or stop/start audio. My rant: this seems to be a trend among high-end earphone producers which is frustrating and idiotic since the iOS 2014 market share was a whopping 12% vs Android's meager 84% (and growing). ~ stats from idc.com
customer_reviews.author: breadbox88

customer_reviews.title: Wood is Good
customer_reviews.text: As far as in-ear headphones go, I can't imagine they get much betted than these; especially at this price. These are the best looking, best sounding, and most comfortable IEHs I've tried and I'm glad to have found out about Grain Audio. The clarity is really impressive, acoustics and cymbals are crystal clear—and the BASS! The bass is just phenomenal; it brings out the bass in quiter tracks and really exentuates it in bass-heavy tracks without distortion or imbalance. I'm not enough of a hobbyist to call myself an audiophile, but I am very picky about audio quality and these ear buds meet all of my requirements and then some.
customer_reviews.author: TheFlyingManatee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good headphones but good god lord almighty
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good headphones but good god lord almighty. This has got to be the most over-designed box in the history of the earth. Some guy probably jacked off to apple before saying he could one up the box designs they have.
customer_reviews.author: geometry_quiz

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these headphones
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these headphones. Very light and comfortable to wear, even for extended periods. The sound out of the IEHP's is wonderful. The highs and mids are very clear, and does not fatigue. And the bass is.. Amazing. Up front. Not muddy. If you like bass in your music, you need to give these a try
customer_reviews.author: Jose M. Arreola

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I have a external battery on my iPhone 5 and this is the only set of headphones that have a small enough diameter plug to fit through the hole in the battery case. The sounds not bad ether....
customer_reviews.author: David Barry Lane

customer_reviews.title: Good earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good, not spectacular. I like the design and "wood" treatment. The rubber ends pop off easily. Luckily I haven't lost them yet, but beware.
customer_reviews.author: clammyfresh

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe I'm saying this... too much bass
customer_reviews.text: Too intense! I love bass-heavy earbuds, but these ones are overwhelming even for my taste. Fun for a novelty, but I experienced ear fatigue after about an hour of continuous listening.
customer_reviews.author: mbiz

customer_reviews.title: I love these xD
customer_reviews.text: I got these in the mail, and I was really excited because I was doing a lottttt of research for earbuds under $150, looking at the shure se215 black originals, the shure se215 LTD blue, and the Bose IE2, and I was originally going to purchase the Bose IE2, until I found a buddy that had the ear-buds and had an ear-bud, leading me to purchase these. If you love base get these. Other wise, you should get the Bose IE2. (Also I got these cuz they look cool too!)
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Christopher Jessick

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like these, but...
customer_reviews.text: Great design, and packaging. I'm not feeling the sound quality to match, though.
customer_reviews.author: Riley Martin WPB

customer_reviews.title: Good quality...decent bass...unique style
customer_reviews.text: Good quality headphones for the price. Decent bass. Unique looking.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Gutschow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you like bass-forward sound, you need a pair of these.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Williams

customer_reviews.title: Insanely great sound and style!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! The look, fit, and most importantly the SOUND on these are BANGIN'! Highly recommended. Volume control works great on iPhone. Thanks to Wirecutter for the recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: J. MCMAHON

customer_reviews.title: They look good and they're feel good
customer_reviews.text: Clear, rich sound, robust bass. They look good and they're feel good. These are what I was looking for: a medium/high-end in-ear headphone that feels like you got your money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Drams

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, average build quality, terrible customer support.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these earbuds a little over a year ago and have been very happy with the sound quality. After about a year of moderate use, the inline microphone & remote ceased working. As I registered my purchase with Grain Audio, they offer an extended 2 year manufacturer's warranty. I've spent the last month trying to contact them for support via both their online form and the email addresses they make available on their site, and have not received a response. While I really like the way these sound, my next purchase will be from a company that actually stands by their products and supports their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Crosby Hayton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome In Ear Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound - best in ear headphones I ever owned - and I've owned several high end pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Bpfjr

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.text: When you first receive the box, it's nothing impressive. I kept thinking to myself for the money I paid, and all of the good reviews - it had to be stellar, right? They're cheap headphones. The wire started fraying on me near the aux plug within the first 5 days and I only use them when I'm working with my computer. It seems like they just added a little bit of base to their headphones and added some wood apparel to make themselves seem different. I wasn't happy with the quality, not worth it to me. Sure, they're okay if they were $50 headphones - but they're not.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great ear buds sound great pretty rugged nice build quality
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE IF YOU ARE AN ANDROID USER (Or at least verify compatibility.)
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the sound, but the lack of a model that works with Android phones makes these unusable. The mic worked on my HTC One M8, but not the buttons. However, neither the mic nor the buttons work with the Samsung Galaxy S6. I partially blame Samsung for what is clearly some proprietary nonsense, but from previous reviews it's clear these never worked with Samsung phones. Such a shame, they sound great.
customer_reviews.author: somedude

customer_reviews.title: After trying what seems like a every earbud in this price range
customer_reviews.text: After trying what seems like a every earbud in this price range, I must say that theses were good quality and worth the money. However, I didn't particularly care for the way they were tuned. It's just a personal thing, I suppose.Maybe you'll like them better than I did.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Peckman

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all.
customer_reviews.text: Okay sound quality. Not at all worth the price. They fell apart in 6 months (one of the wood buds came a little misshapen, I didnt think it was serious. It then completely broke in half and I couldn't use that bud anymore. I used them less than 10 times. I didn't call customer service. Not worth any more frustration.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Hugely overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I buy a lot of headphones and these were unimpressive, especially at this price point. To be honest, they sounded like $15 headphones. Super muddy bass, tinny highs. I passed them down to my 7 year old niece who seems happy enough with them, but they're definitely not for audiophiles and the price point is absurd.
customer_reviews.author: magic

customer_reviews.title: ... a pair of earphones I expect I will be satisfied. I was not
customer_reviews.text: When I pay 100$ for a pair of earphones I expect I will be satisfied. I was not, the sound was rustling and on of the buds played really weak. I returned the order and the refund was already issued so it's okay. Maybe I just recieved a bad piece.
customer_reviews.author: Aleš Valtr

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds sound great! The base is very booming and the sound quality is very good... they are very comfortable and I can wear them for hours at a time! Would recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: shannon noji

customer_reviews.title: the quality was good but i must have weird ears because i just ...
customer_reviews.text: the quality was good but i must have weird ears because i just could not get these to stay in my ears tried all the tips did not fit had to send em back
customer_reviews.author: totto2222

customer_reviews.title: so much better. i promise
customer_reviews.text: these are expensive as sht for the quality of buds you get. do yourself a favor and grab some sennheisers. so much better. i promise. yea i know what i'm talking about. i dont listen to edm.
customer_reviews.author: Milhouse John Koh

customer_reviews.title: They didn't sound bad, but not to my liking
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the ear buds i was considering to replace my sure 101SE from many years ago. I ended up purchasing something else, but i got to try these in a store today. I can't say that i was very impressed by these. They didn't sound bad, but not to my liking. The bass was very forward, yet not that full or clean sounding to me. I also felt like the mids were lacking. I highly recommend you try to demo these in a store. I ended up getting a pair that has a definite better balance and amazon was selling it for $50 down from $120(i believe).
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: My New Favorite Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these through the Kickstarter campaign and after using these for a month, I can tell you they are amazing. I upgraded from my Klipsch s4 headphones to these and I couldn't be happier about it. The quality of sound is on a whole different level. The carrying case is well designed and I carry these with me every day. The Klipsch headphones came in a metal case that was way too big for my pocket. After a while without a case, the cables on the Klipsch got damaged and the sound stopped in one ear. I'm not worried with these. The case is flexible and fits in my pocket. These will last forever. Buy them.
customer_reviews.author: sjstone

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I backed Grain Audio on Kickstarter and received my headphones yesterday, I used them this morning on my commute and had to write a review as I was so impressed with them. These blow my Bose IE2's out of the water for sound quality, I'm hearing parts of songs I never knew existed before and I honestly can't believe headphones of this quality are selling for $99, if you're on the fence, don't hesitate any more, buy these now, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dean O'Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Kickstarter Backer
customer_reviews.text: I just received my IEHP.01 today, and I must say, theses are by far the best In-ear Headphones I've have owned by far. The packaging was nice, they include 4 sizes of buds and a very durable carrying case. It feels like canvas. Also, the warranty isn't bad at all. You get the one year. But then if you register online after you get the headphones, they throw in one extra year for free. Not bad. I'm also am waiting for their over the ear headphones, the OEHP. Just based on this pair I have, I can expect great things from Grain Audio.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Do your self a favor, throw out your ipod headphones and get these!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones make my life more enjoyable. The subwoofer that comes out of them is unbelievable. I was just chillin tonight and I chose these headphones over my Bose Quietcomfort 15 ($300 headphones). Looking at all of the fools on the subway with the ipod headphones kills me thinking how much of the music they are missing out on. Thank you Grain Audio, keep doing what you're doing.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Clean Sounding, But More Form Over Function
customer_reviews.text: These replace over-ear headphones which get too warm to walk around with in the Summer. Of course there's no comparison between over and in-ear, so I'm not trying to make one. For in-ear, these are very crisp clean sounding. If you're looking for bass response or a "fuller" sound, this isn't the pair to get. These are definitely about form over function.
customer_reviews.author: P. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: In-Ear Headphones for People who Don't Typically like In-Ear Heaphones
customer_reviews.text: For as long as I've used headphones, I've never liked a single pair of in-ear headphones. Not only does the sound tend to crackle and pop, but they are incredibly uncomfortable. However, Grain Audio has managed to create a set of in-ear headphones that sounds better than some over-ear headphones, which is impressive. Even better is that they are comfortable and I can listen to music for as long as I'd like without ever feeling a bit of irritation. So if you need discreet headphones, but hate in-ear headphones, Grain Audio has developed a pair sure to be the exception.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Dimeck

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, but..
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones But be careful before ordering cause volume controls only work with Iphone, plus they have difficulty staying in my ears while working out. I have tried all of the supplied rubber earpieces, but non of them seem to make earphones to stay in my ears without constant need of reajustment
customer_reviews.author: Alder Elite Woodworks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound like they should cost way more. I cannot say enough great things about these headphones. They look great too. I have no trouble wearing these with my suits on my way to work or when i'm working at my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Conor  Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Kickstarter Backer
customer_reviews.text: So I contributed to the Kickstarter of this product, and I could not have been happier with the final product. These are a quality set of in-ear headphones that sound like they should cost MUCH more than they do. They're incredible, and I find myself listening to MUCH more music than I had previously because they're so amazing. If you're a music fan, you can't go wrong with these. The best bang for the price, hands down.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kwiatkowski

customer_reviews.title: Microphone stopped working after first use
customer_reviews.text: Probably had really high expectations for my first earbuds costing more than $40... which made the letdown even bigger after discovering the microphone didn't work after first use. I mean the company did offer to send a replacement.. but you'd kinda expect quality control to be built into the price... assuming that was the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality, best price
customer_reviews.text: After one month with them I have to say that they are the best headphones I've tried so far in that range of price, the sound quality is exceptional, They look and sound great. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: When I pay $100 for a pair of earbuds, ...
customer_reviews.text: When I pay $100 for a pair of earbuds, I expect a $100 pair of earbuds. Within 24 hours of buying these, the rubber part which connects the plastic part (which is connected to the part which goes in the socket) tore from the plastic part which it WAS connected to. This is highly unacceptable and this is definitely a qc issue. Otherwise these headphones are fine. If this happened on a $10 pair of earbuds, that's fine. But that's not what I spend $100 on.
customer_reviews.author: Gavi Shapiro

product_meta.title: Grain Audio IEHP.01 In Ear Headphones, Brown/Grey
product_meta.description: Earbuds redefined. The 2014 Red Dot Design Award winning In-Ear Headphones from Grain Audio deliver perfect sound and design. Owners of this product can maintain their style without sacrificing any audio quality. The solid walnut casings ensure the best possible sound with crystal clear highs and booming lows. The comfort fit design allows people to rock for hours without any pain, ensuring that the IEHPs will be the earbuds of choice for music and design lovers alike. We pair each enclosure with our proprietary driver that features a Neodymium magnet and a CCAW voice coil. Go ahead and translate that to "AWESOME". Awesome sound that is balanced to give you a better listening experience than anything else on the market. Like all of our products, the design of the IEHP is an exercise in purpose and restraint. The silicone strain relief protects the wood housing and is comfortable on the ear and to the touch. The inline mic is simple and intuitive to use. There are no unnecessary flourishes or extraneous details.
feature_bullets: Paired each enclosure with our proprietary driver (2x8mm proprietary loudspeakers) that features a Neodymium magnet and a CCAW voice coil
Inline mic and remote is simple and intuitive to use
3.5mm jack; fits all smartphones and most MP3 Players
FSC certified walnut housings with hand-applied oil finish

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars64 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
